justification: “To study the impairments in emotion-based decision-making, the Iowa Gambling Task (Bechara et al., 1994) is the key experimental paradigm.”
The BGT is described as “a replaceable alternative to measure the same construct” as the IGT, allowing within-person reassessment of emotion-based learning.
The authors state that being naïve to the IGT is “essential to adequate assessment of the emotion-based learning construct,” indicating the IGT measures this construct.
The paper notes that “the theoretical underpinnings of the BGT and IGT reside in approach-avoidance motivation,” linking the BGT to this motivational construct.
In the same sentence, the authors include the IGT when stating that both tasks’ underpinnings “reside in approach-avoidance motivation.”
